nextItems.title: Hair brittleness
nextItems.description: Hair brittle or breaks off easily

nextItems.title: Hair pluckability
nextItems.description: Ask client if they have noticed any changes to the texture of the hair. Gently pull on a few stands to check if hair is easily plucked

nextItems.title: Temporalis muscle wasting
nextItems.description: Have patient turn the head to the side. Gently palpate the temple region with fingertips.

nextItems.title: Orbital sockets
nextItems.description: View the client from the front. Gently palpate under the eyes and above the cheekbones with your middle finger, feeling for a lack of orbital fat pads. Look for dark rings and loose skin.
options: Slightly hollow above cheekbones and some darkening
Severely hollow and depressed, loose skin, dark circles

nextItems.title: Tongue color
nextItems.description: Using a tongue depressor, examine for bright red color.

nextItems.title: Tongue texture
nextItems.description: Using a tongue depressor, examine for smooth texture.

nextItems.title: Teeth
nextItems.description: Inspect for missing teeth and/or ill-fitting dentures.

nextItems.title: Clavicle
nextItems.description: Ask client to sit up straight with arms at the side. Visibly inspect the clavicle area of both sides of the client and palpate the area for muscle loss.
options: Clavicle and acromion process visible or protruding, concave depression

nextItems.title: Scapular to Hips
nextItems.description: Visibly inspect the rib cage area while the client is sitting upright (ribs should not be visible). Ask client to extend their arm out straight in front of them and push a solid surface. Gently palpate above and below the scapular bone.
options: Mild depression above and below scapula and iliac crest
Prominent depression scapular, between ribs, and iliac region

nextItems.title: Difficulty breathing
options: No shortness of breath with activity
Moderate shortness of breath or difficulty breathing

nextItems.title: Triceps
nextItems.description: Have patient bend arm at a 90 degree angle and relax triceps area. Gently pinch the skin with thumb and forefinger and roll the skin under the triceps to assess fat.
options: Normal rolling of fat when pinched
Thumb and finger easily touch together while pinching

nextItems.title: Hand
nextItems.description: Have patient squeeze thumb to the side of their finger or touch thumb and index finger together to make the OK sign to assess dorsal muscle.

nextItems.title: Hand grip strength
nextItems.description: Requires dynamometer. Have patient hold dynamometer in right hand with arm at 90 degree angle, elbow at the side, and wrist at 0-30 degree flex. Tell patient to squeeze with maximum force and hold (for 5 seconds or until the dynamometer small needle begins to lower). Use average of 3 successive trials with 60 second rest between trials

nextItems.title: Nails
options: Moderate changes: half white/brown, brittle, concave spoon shape, or ridges
Severely brittle, concave spoon shape, or ridges

nextItems.title: Skin turgor
nextItems.description: Pinch skin and observe recoil time.

nextItems.title: Patella
nextItems.description: Have patient prop up leg with knee bent at a right angle. Make sure that the back of the knee is not resting against bed or chair
options: Normal muscle protrusion, knee bone not prominent
Knee bone prominent and/or square, qua muscle curves inward at knee joint

nextItems.title: Gastronemius
nextItems.description: Have patient prop up leg with knee at a right angle. Gently grasp calf to assess amount and quality of muscle present.
options: Well developed bulb of muscle with firm texture
Mildly developed muscle with somewhat spongy quality
Undeveloped muscle and spongy texture quality

nextItems.title: Ankle and foot
nextItems.description: Press firmly on the top of foot or tibial bone to assess for fluid accumulation or edema
options: Moderate indentation < 30 seconds or < 6 mm deep
Deep indentation > 30 seconds or > 6 mm deep

nextItems.title: Weight loss
options: Unintended weight loss < 10 pounds or < 5% in 1 month or < 7.5% in 3 months
Unintended weight loss > 10 pounds or < 5% in 1 month or < 7.5% in 3 months

nextItems.title: Weight gain
options: Unintended gain > 10 pounds in past 3 months
